title: The world may be safer for the death of Baghdadi, but eradicating his poisonous ideology will be far harder
text:
It was not quite Donald Trump’s bin Laden moment but not far off it. Just as Barack Obama was able to watch the operation leading to the demise of the al-Qaeda leader at the hands of US special forces, so his White House successor could claim a scalp of his own, and he did so with alacrity.

The killing of the Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi is the final act in the destruction of the self-styled caliphate that he established. The number of deaths that can be laid at his door is probably incalculable but runs into the many thousands. His final victims were apparently his own family when he detonated a suicide vest to avoid capture and killed himself and three children.

He came to prominence...
description: It was not quite Donald Trump’s bin Laden moment but not far off it.
